coredata.dc:title: Affective experience of music emotional and color perception of folk and other musical genres

abstract.publishercopyright: © 2018 Zalozba Z R C. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: The article presents an experimental study of the emotional and color perception of music, focusing on folk music in comparison with other musical genres. The analysis showed that some musical emotions are conveyed differently between different genres. Overall, Folk genre had the most balanced distribution of the emotions used in the ratings, along with Pop and Rock. On the other hand, Punk and Metal had over 40% of their ratings represented by only two emotions, liveliness and anger. This is further reflected in the emotion-color associations. The presented findings point to the genre specificity of musical emotions.

affiliation.affilname: Znanstvenoraziskovalni center Slovenske akademije znanosti in umetnosti

xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency: Center for Outcomes Research and Evaluation, Yale School of Medicine

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: 1 The co-author Gregor Strle acknowledges the financial support from the Slovenian Research Agency (research core funding No. P6-0111, Research on Slovenian Folk Culture in Folklore Studies and Ethnology).

abstract.publishercopyright: © 2018 Zalozba Z R C. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: The article presents an experimental study of the emotional and color perception of music, focusing on folk music in comparison with other musical genres. The analysis showed that some musical emotions are conveyed differently between different genres. Overall, Folk genre had the most balanced distribution of the emotions used in the ratings, along with Pop and Rock. On the other hand, Punk and Metal had over 40% of their ratings represented by only two emotions, liveliness and anger. This is further reflected in the emotion-color associations. The presented findings point to the genre specificity of musical emotions.
